## Be Prepared for Whatever Comes Your Way
![](https://arpio.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/outages-icon.svg)
### Outages
Maintain operational continuity during cloud outages with minimal disruption.
![](https://arpio.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/ransomware-icon.svg)
### Ransomware
Recover safely from ransomware attacks without giving in to ransom demands.
![](https://arpio.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/bad-actors-icon.svg)
### Bad Actors
Whether it's insider threats or outside hackers, your business will always be able to recover.
![](https://arpio.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/data-loss-icon-1.svg)
### Data Loss
Never. Lose. Data. Arpio's got your back.
For security pros guarding the fort, Arpio is the ace up your sleeve. Outages? They’re handled. Ransomware? It’s a setback, not a disaster. With Arpio, you’re prepped with a recovery environment your adversaries can’t touch, ready to switch on like a backup generator.

![](https://arpio.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/30-minute-setup-icon.svg)

No automation to write, no AWS docs to decode. You can have DR in place today.

Automatic replication, change detection and real-time alerts. This is your DR on autopilot.
![](https://arpio.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/one-click-testing-icon.svg)
### One-Click Testing
True DR tests without disrupting production. Zero long weekends, 100% confidence.
![](https://arpio.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/data-loss-icon.svg)
### Recover in Minutes
Recover quickly from outages. Recover safely from ransomware. Zero data loss.

## Got questions? We’ve got answers.
Doesn’t AWS already have disaster recovery?
There are a lot of backup and recovery features in AWS, but assembling these into a disaster recovery capability is your responsibility. It’s part of AWS’s “shared responsibility model.” You can read about it [here](https://arpio.io/<https:/docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/disaster-recovery-workloads-on-aws/shared-responsibility-model-for-resiliency.html>).
How will using Arpio impact my AWS bill?
Arpio replicates data and infrastructure into an AWS account that you control, so you’ll be responsible for the cost of data storage and transfer. But we use the most cost-effective techniques available in AWS, and our customers often report that their DR environment costs just 1-2% of their production environment.
Can I use Arpio to recover from a ransomware attack?
Yes! Arpio maintains historical snapshots of your environment, and you can use Arpio to recover to a point in time before the ransomware attack began. Arpio also protects your backups so that the attacker can’t undermine your ability to recover.
Will there be data loss when I failover with Arpio?
That depends on your recovery point objective (your RPO), and which AWS services you’re using. For many services, Arpio can replicate your data as it is updated in production, so there’s nothing lost (or close to it!) if you need to failover.
How does failback work with Arpio?
Arpio’s failback process takes a snapshot of the data in your recovery environment and restores it to the original infrastructure in your production environment. You can test the failback process as many times as you’d like so you’ll be confident that it will work when it’s finally time to return to your primary environment.
Do I have to have infrastructure automation in place?
Nope! It’s great if you do, but Arpio is driven by what you’ve got in your production environment, not what’s written in your automation. Our customers span the spectrum from no automation to full automation, and everything in between.
How do I test my DR solution with Arpio?
Arpio makes DR testing easy and non-disruptive for your production workloads. Arpio allows you to easily spin up your recovery environment in test mode, giving you an opportunity to validate that your applications would work in a failover scenario. While in test mode, your production system remains online and processing production traffic. And, because of Arpio’s sophisticated automation, the full testing process can often be completed in minutes. Gone are the days of working a long weekend to validate your DR during an outage window.

## Got questions? We’ve got answers.
Doesn’t AWS already have disaster recovery?
There are a lot of backup and recovery features in AWS, but assembling these into a disaster recovery capability is your responsibility. It’s part of AWS’s “shared responsibility model.” You can read about it here⟨38⟩.
How will using Arpio impact my AWS bill?
Arpio replicates data and infrastructure into an AWS account that you control, so you’ll be responsible for the cost of data storage and transfer. But we use the most cost-effective techniques available in AWS, and our customers often report that their DR environment costs just 1-2% of their production environment.
Can I use Arpio to recover from a ransomware attack?
Yes! Arpio maintains historical snapshots of your environment, and you can use Arpio to recover to a point in time before the ransomware attack began. Arpio also protects your backups so that the attacker can’t undermine your ability to recover.
Will there be data loss when I failover with Arpio?
That depends on your recovery point objective (your RPO), and which AWS services you’re using. For many services, Arpio can replicate your data as it is updated in production, so there’s nothing lost (or close to it!) if you need to failover.
How does failback work with Arpio?
Arpio’s failback process takes a snapshot of the data in your recovery environment and restores it to the original infrastructure in your production environment. You can test the failback process as many times as you’d like so you’ll be confident that it will work when it’s finally time to return to your primary environment.
Do I have to have infrastructure automation in place?
Nope! It’s great if you do, but Arpio is driven by what you’ve got in your production environment, not what’s written in your automation. Our customers span the spectrum from no automation to full automation, and everything in between.
How do I test my DR solution with Arpio?
Arpio makes DR testing easy and non-disruptive for your production workloads. Arpio allows you to easily spin up your recovery environment in test mode, giving you an opportunity to validate that your applications would work in a failover scenario. While in test mode, your production system remains online and processing production traffic. And, because of Arpio’s sophisticated automation, the full testing process can often be completed in minutes. Gone are the days of working a long weekend to validate your DR during an outage window.

### Mission

Arpio's mission is straightforward: **Recover from any outage in 10 minutes or less.** In an age where every second counts, especially for businesses relying on AWS applications, Arpio offers an essential safety net.

---

### What They Do

Initially launched as a SaaS solution designed to eliminate downtime for AWS applications, Arpio specializes in disaster recovery. Their platform allows businesses to protect their critical applications from unexpected outages and ransomware attacks, ensuring operational continuity.

**Arpio's Capabilities:**
- **Automated Disaster Recovery:** Cross-region and cross-account recovery for AWS environments.
- **Rapid Recovery:** Outages can be handled within minutes, significantly reducing stress for IT teams.
- **Comprehensive Protection:** Arpio recognizes and replicates everything necessary for your cloud workloads, including servers, databases, networking, security settings, and more.

### Target Audience

Primarily focused on **B2B clients**, Arpio tailors its solutions for various sectors including:
- Healthcare
- Financial Services
- General SaaS Technologies

This means they're not just protecting data; they're securing the operational lifeblood of industries where downtime can mean catastrophe.

---

### Why Choose Arpio?

1. **Speed:** Recovery in just minutes, which can drastically impact a company's bottom line and reputation.
2. **Ease of Use:** A setup that requires no complex automation—businesses can have disaster recovery plans in place in as little as 30 minutes.
3. **Continuous Features:**
   - **Real-Time Alerts:** Stay informed about the health of your environment.
   - **One-Click Testing:** Validate your recovery processes without disrupting production.
   - **Immutable Backups:** Protect your backups from being tampered with by attackers.

### Customer Testimonials

Arpio has made a strong impression on its clients. Companies like Spiffy and Choice Hotels emphasize the simplicity and reliability of the platform, noting how it has transformed their disaster recovery processes. For instance, Ryan Eade, CTO of Spiffy, remarked, “After our implementation, we’ve had great success with our ongoing DR tests, and the platform is easy for everyone on the team to understand.”

---

### Conclusion

In a digital landscape full of unpredictability, Arpio steps in as a robust ally for businesses leveraging AWS. With their focus on fast recovery, ease of use, and comprehensive safeguards, they position themselves as a vital part of a modern tech stack. Whether you’re a startup or an enterprise, considering the resilience of your infrastructure is crucial, and Arpio makes that process not just feasible, but efficient. Explore their offerings [here](https://arpio.io).
